intro: Ainsliaea pteropoda var. macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. This variant is distinguished by its larger flower heads compared to other varieties of Ainsliaea pteropoda.
